source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
topic: 3.5.2 The functions of person-marked converbs in Sakha
notes: Nevertheless, there are three clearly discernible trends in the function of person-marked converbs: firstly, they emphasize the main actant of the sentence; as such, one occasionally finds strings of person-marked converbs and one or even several instances of free pronouns in the same sentence, i.e. an ‘overload’ of subject reference (114). Secondly, they facilitate reference tracking in discourse, being used after (and occasionally before) a switch in discourse referent (115). This contrasts with the use of unmarked converbs in sequences of sentences where no switch in discourse referent has taken place (116). And lastly, there is a discernible, though low-frequency tendency for person-marked Perfective Converbs to take the place of finite verbs, suggesting grammaticalization of a new TAM form (117a, b).
sah: Чэ, онон бу киһиэхэ мин бэрт эрэйинэн харгыйан тоҥон өлбөххөбүн чэ син хас да сыл ол курдук олорбохтоон иһэммин ыалы кэрийэммин ыал хонук маһын мастыыр буолан бараммын чэ баран хааллым бу киһиттэн тэйэн букатын.
en: Well, with that person it was difficult, I was hungry and cold, but I didn't die, well, I lived like that for a few years, I made the round of the people (I went from house to house), I chopped a day's worth of wood for people, well I left, I left this person completely. [well that.OBL–INS this person.DAT 1SG INTS labour–INS be.hungry–PF.CVB freeze–PF.CVB die–PRV.CVB–PRED.1SG well fairly how.many PTL year that like sit–INTS–PF.CVB DUR–PF.CVB–PRED.1SG family–ACC make.the.round–PF.CVB–PRED.1SG family 24.hour.period wood–ACC.3SG wood–VR–PRSPT AUX–PF.CVB go–PF.CVB–PRED.1SG well go–PF.CVB RES–PST–POSS.1SG this man–ABL leave–PF.CVB completely]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
topic: 3.5.2 The functions of person-marked converbs in Sakha
notes: Nevertheless, there are three clearly discernible trends in the function of person-marked converbs: firstly, they emphasize the main actant of the sentence; as such, one occasionally finds strings of person-marked converbs and one or even several instances of free pronouns in the same sentence, i.e. an ‘overload’ of subject reference (114). Secondly, they facilitate reference tracking in discourse, being used after (and occasionally before) a switch in discourse referent (115). This contrasts with the use of unmarked converbs in sequences of sentences where no switch in discourse referent has taken place (116). And lastly, there is a discernible, though low-frequency tendency for person-marked Perfective Converbs to take the place of finite verbs, suggesting grammaticalization of a new TAM form (117a, b).
en: But they didn't send me. [CP give–PSTPT.NEG–POSS.3PL]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

en: Thinking I would go to school, I was very happy (lit: flew). [learn go–PURP.CVB–PRED.1SG fly–PSTPT–POSS.1SG INTS]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
topic: 3.5.2 The functions of person-marked converbs in Sakha
notes: Nevertheless, there are three clearly discernible trends in the function of person-marked converbs: firstly, they emphasize the main actant of the sentence; as such, one occasionally finds strings of person-marked converbs and one or even several instances of free pronouns in the same sentence, i.e. an ‘overload’ of subject reference (114). And lastly, there is a discernible, though low-frequency tendency for person-marked Perfective Converbs to take the place of finite verbs, suggesting grammaticalization of a new TAM form (117a, b).
en: But my family didn't let me (lit: give me). [CP people–POSS.1SG COLL give–PSTPT.NEG–POSS.3PL]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

sah: Үс сыл устата онно бара сырыттым мин ол Сутуоҥҥа аллара Яныскайга.
en: For three years I was there, in Zaton, down in Yanskiy. [three year length–POSS.3SG that.OBL–LOC go–IPF.CVB IPFV–PST–POSS.1SG 1SG that S.–DAT down Y.–DAT]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

notes: Nevertheless, there are three clearly discernible trends in the function of person-marked converbs: firstly, they emphasize the main actant of the sentence; as such, one occasionally finds strings of person-marked converbs and one or even several instances of free pronouns in the same sentence, i.e. an ‘overload’ of subject reference (114). sah: Дьэ ол онтон ыла дьэ үлэни хамнаһы кыайан дьэ киһи кэбигэр дьэ киирэн дьон кэххэтигэр дьэ сыллар буоллум.
en: Well, from there on, being able to work and earn money, well I became a person (lit: entered the form of people), I became a grown-up, on equal footing with the others (lit: went in the rows of people). [well that that.OBL–ABL take–IPF.CVB well work–ACC salary–ACC be.able–PF.CVB well person form–DAT.3SG well enter–PF.CVB people row–DAT.3SG well go–PRSPT AUX–PST–POSS.1SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

sah: Сонтон ыла дьэ бу сырыттаҕым дии үлэлээн хамнаан.
en: Well, from then on I lived like this, working. [EMPH–that.OBL–ABL take–IPF.CVB well this go–MDL–POSS.1SG ASS work–VR–PF.CVB earn–PF.CVB]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

sah: Биһиги отто былыр Сухаана нэһилиэгэр олороммут.
en: Well, in the past we lived in the Suxana nasleg. [1PL CP in.the.past S. nasleg–DAT.3SG sit–PF.CVB–1PL]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.

sah: Ол иһин биһиги көмөлөһөммүт бастакы үөрэҕин саҕалаан.
en: So therefore we helped her when she first began her studies. [that for 1PL help–PF.CVB–1PL first studies–ACC.3SG begin–PF.CVB]
